revised_title: Abel's Theorem and its Applications in Transcendental Functions
tldr: This article presents a simplified and generalized version of Abel's famous memoir on a general property of a class of transcendental functions. The author aims to make the subject more accessible by reorganizing parts, separating essential steps, and introducing a symbol and theorem discussed by Boole. The article also explores applications of Abel's theorem in the comparison of transcendental functions and the summation of integrals.
